SEARCH
Package tetrisgame

Class TetrisSquare

java.lang.Object
tetrisgame.TetrisSquare
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TetrisSquare extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single square in the Tetris game grid. Each square has a position, a color, and a bool lock state indicating if it is locked in place
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    Constructs a TetrisSquare at the specified position with the base color.

    Constructs a copy of another TetrisSquare.

  • Constructor Details

    • TetrisSquare

      public TetrisSquare(int xX, int yY)
      Constructs a TetrisSquare at the specified position with the base color. The default state is unlocked, becuase the square is not occupied by a Tetromino when initialized
      Parameters:
      xX - The x-coordinate of the square.
      yY - The y-coordinate of the square.

    • TetrisSquare

      public TetrisSquare(TetrisSquare copy)
      Constructs a copy of another TetrisSquare.
      Parameters:
      copy - The TetrisSquare to copy.

  • Method Details

    • setY

      public void setY(int y)
      Sets the y-coordinate of the square. We define seperate setters and getters for better readability, instead of calling square.getPosition().setY()
      Parameters:
      y - The new y-coordinate.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Gets the y-coordinate of the square.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate.

    • setX

      public void setX(int x)
      Sets the x-coordinate of the square.
      Parameters:
      x - The new x-coordinate.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Gets the x-coordinate of the square.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate.

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Gets the color of the square.
      Returns:
      The current color of the square.

    • setColor

      public void setColor(Color c)
      Sets the color of the square.
      Parameters:
      c - The new color. Color

    • getPosition

      public Coord getPosition()
      Gets the position of the square.
      Returns:
      The position as a Coord object. Coord

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(Coord co)
      Sets the position of the square.
      Parameters:
      co - The new position as a Coord object.

    • lock

      public void lock()
      Locks the square, indicating it is locked in place, has been placed down

    • unlock

      public void unlock()
      Unlocks the square

    • isLocked

      public boolean isLocked()
      Checks if the square is locked.
      Returns:
      True if the square is locked, false otherwise.
